alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 11:22AM EST until December 26 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch before mixing with some rain. Snow accumulations will be less than an inch. * WHERE...All of northern New York and the western and north central sections of Vermont. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain will begin to taper off this afternoon, but ice covered roads will continue to produce difficult travel conditions. Some rain may mix in over parts of the northern Adirondacks and Champlain Valley this afternoon, but road temperatures may remain below freezing continuing the threat for icy roads. Light freezing drizzle will be possible tonight through Sunday morning leading to additional ice accretion.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
